intro: Crotalaria chrysantha, commonly known as golden crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is a herbaceous annual or perennial plant characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and palmately lobed leaves. The plant belongs to the family Fabaceae, also known as the legume or bean family, and is known for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil. Its flowers are typically clustered in racemes and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Crotalaria chrysantha is often used in traditional medicine and has ornamental value due to its bright, showy blooms.
